intro: Heracleum ossethicum, commonly known as the Ossethian cowparn, is a herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family, and its fruits are small, dry schizocarps. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
